### **About Me**

I'm an _Epidemiologist_ and a _Chronic Disease Researcher_ with 8+ years of diverse experience in the Healthcare Industry. I graduated from _Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health_ in May, 2020. Before Columbia, I earned a Bachelor of Dental Surgery from India which is equivalent to the Doctor of Dental Surgery in the US. 
I am passionate about working at the forefront of chronic disease prevention in areas such as cancer, neurological and cardiovascular diseases. I love challenges and enjoy coming up with elegant and innovative solutions to challenging problems. 

### **Enable**

![](Enable.jpg)

I am the President and Founder of [Enable](https://mailman-columbia.campuslabs.com/engage/organization/enable).
Enable is a student organization at Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health.The mission of Enable is to destigmatize disability of all forms.The organization aims to accomplish this mission by: 

* Providing a platform for discussion on disability
* Creating awareness about all forms of disabilities through educational events
* Listing out the ‘during and after-school’ resources for the students with disabilities
* Creating opportunities for volunteerism and advocacy regarding disability within the school.

As a Founder and President of Enable, my responsibilities included:

* Identifying the needs of students with disabilities through one-on-one and focus group interviews
* Registering the organisation, and recruiting the first E-board of the organisation
* Planning, organising and executing events to raise awareness on disability and destigmatize disability
* Monitoring semesterly expenses per event via keeping receipts from vendors and submitted reimbursements to the Office of Student Affairs to ensure the stable functioning of the organization.
* Collaborating with other organizations for on-campus events for community engagement

**Please follow Enable on [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/enable_at_columbia/)**
